Sch.Cm: Annotations are used to add comments or qualifiers to entity instances in ODM2.

Tbl.Cm: Notes for or groups of one or more Actions.

Cl.Cm: Foreign key of the Action being annotated.
Foreign key of the annotation being added to the Action.

Tbl.Cm: Contains text annotations added to one or more records within various ODM2 tables. Annotations can be used to record notes about a particular SamplingFeature, Action, Result, etc. or to create groups of records such as Specimens, Sites, People, etc.

Cl.Cm: Primary key for Annotations.
CV for types of annotations.
A short text code that identifies the annotation (e.g., "A' for "Approved data").
Full text of the annotation.
Date and time at which the annotation was created.
UTCOffset for the annotation creation date/time.
Foregn key identifier for the person that created the annotation

Tbl.Cm: Notes for or groups of one or more Methods.

Cl.Cm: Foreign key of the method being annotated
Foreign key of the annotation added to the method

Tbl.Cm: Notes for or groups of one or more Results [sets].

Cl.Cm: Foreign key of the result being annotated
Foreign key of the annotation added to the result
Beginning date/time of the annotation
Ending date/time of the annotation

Tbl.Cm: Notes for or groups of one or more ResultValues.

Cl.Cm: Foreign key of the result value being annotated
Foreign key of the annotation applied to the result value

Tbl.Cm: Notes for or groups of one or more Sampling Features.

Cl.Cm: Foreign key of the SamplingFeature being annotated.
Foreign key of the Annotation applied to the SamplingFeature.

Sch.Cm: The core of ODM2. Every ODM2 instance will implement the Core.

Tbl.Cm: Affiliates people with actions and describes thier role in the action.

Cl.Cm: Foreign key identifier of an action.
Foreign key identifier of a person
Indicator of whether the affiliated person was the lead for the action
Foreign key identifier for a role played by a person in performing an action

Tbl.Cm: Describes actions (e.g., observation, sample collection, sample analysis, field visits, field activities, etc.)

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier
CV term describing the type of action (e.g., observation, sample collection, sample analysis)
Foreign key identifier for the method used to complete the action
The date/time at which the action began
The UTCOffset for the BeginDateTime
The date/time at which the action ended
The UTCOffset of for the EndDateTime
Text that describes the action
A URL or path to a file created by or used by the Action, such as instrument output or configuration.

Tbl.Cm: Describes affiliations of people with organizations.

Cl.Cm: Primay key
Foreign key identifer for a person
Foreigh key identifier for an organization
Boolean indication of whether the person is the organizations primary contact person
The date on which the person became affiliated with the organization
The date on which the person's affiliation with the organization ended
The primary phone number of the person
The primary email address of the person
The primary mailing address of the person, including street, city, state, zip, and country
A URL for the website for a person

Tbl.Cm: Describes groupings of observation results that can be considered "datasets"

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier
CV term(s) describing the Topic Category
A short text code identifying the dataset
A text title for the dataset
A text abstract describing the dataset
Text citation for Dataset itself

Tbl.Cm: Lists the Results that are grouped into a DataSet

Cl.Cm: Foreign key identifier of the DataSet
Foreign key identifier of the Result

Tbl.Cm: Describes methods used to perform actions recorded in ODM (e.g., observation methods, sample analysis methods, sample preparation methods, etc.)

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier
CV term describing the type of method (e.g., sample collection, laboratory analytical, field, sample prepratation, etc.)
A text code identifiying the method (e.g., EPA 650.2)
Full text name of the method
Full text description of the method
A URL to a full description of the method
Foreign key identifier for the Organization with which the method is affiliated

Tbl.Cm: Describes organizations - as in research groups, companies, universities, etc.

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier
CV term defining the type of organization (e.g., government agency, university, etc.)
A text code identifying the Organization (e.g., USGS)
The full text name of the organization
A text description of the organization
A URL for the organization's website
Foreign key of the parent organization of the current organization

Tbl.Cm: Describes people.

Cl.Cm: Primary Key
First name of the person
Middle name of the person
Last name of the person

Tbl.Cm: Describes the processing level of Results

Cl.Cm: Primary key identifier
Text code identifying the level of processing the Result has been subject to
Text defintion of the processing level
Text explanation of the processing level

Tbl.Cm: Describes Actions that are related to one another.

Cl.Cm: Foreign key identifier of the Action
Text description of the relationship between two Actions

Tbl.Cm: Describes the results of observation actions (e.g., groups of one or more numeric data values that result from an observation action)

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier
Universally unique identifier for the Result
Foreign key identifier for the combinaton of SamplingFeature and Action that created the Result
CV term describing the result type (e.g., time series, measurement, etc.)
Foreign key identifier for the Variable of the result
Foreign key identifier for the Units of the result
Foreign key identifier for the ProcessingLevel of the result
Date and time at which the result became available (could be used as analysis time for samples)
UTDCOffset of ResultDateTime
Date and time for which the result is valid (e.g., for a forecast result). Should probably be expressed as a duration
UTCOffset of ValidDateTime
Status of the result (e.g., finished, ongoing, etc.)
CV term defining the environmental medium that the result represents (e.g., air, soil, water)
Number of data values contained within the result
Intended temporal spacing of the observations in the result

Tbl.Cm: Describes the sampling features on which observations are made.

Cl.Cm: Primary key.
CV term descripting the type of sampling feature.
Sampling Feature name (free text).
Text describing the sampling feature.
Dimensionality of SamplingFeature; point2d, line2d, etc.
Actual geometry of the feature. (In Emilio's use case, limited to 2D geometries in epsg:4326). Can be Point, Curve (profile, trajectory, etc), Surface (flat polygons, etc), Solid
ID
Controlled Vocabulary for the type of taxonomy
Taxonomic classification
Taxonomic classification using a common name
Description or remarks about Taxonomic Classifier
ID of the Classifier that is one higher level in the taxonomic hiearchy

Tbl.Cm: Describes units of measure for varibles and time

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier
CV term that defines the unit type
Text abbreviation for the unit
Text name for the unit

Tbl.Cm: Stores information about measured properties.

Cl.Cm: Primary key
Controlled vocabulary for the type of variable
Unique text code for the variable
Controlled vocabulary for the name of the variable
Text definition of the variable
Speciation for the variable (e.g., expressed as P or as PO4)

Tbl.Cm: Table containing terms used in the controlled vocabularies of ODM2.

Cl.Cm: Primary key
Controlled vocabulary term
Definition of term
Name of the ODM controlled vocabulary to which the term belongs
Name and/or description of the source vocabulary from which the term was derived
Primary Key for DataQuality entity
i.e. Precision_2sigma, MethodDetectionLimit, ReportingLevel, 95%ConfidenceNoFalsePositives.
Code for DataQualityType
Numeric value of the DataQuality
Units for the DataQualityValue
Text description of the DataQuality metadata
URL or path to a file or other resource supporting the DataQuality metadata

Tbl.Cm: Describes materials that are used for the calibration of an instrument, the assessment of a measurement method, or for assigning values to unknown specimens.

Cl.Cm: The primary key to the Reference Material used to calibrate an instrument, assess a measurement method, or assign values to unknown specimens
The medium of a Reference Material, from the same CV as SpecimenMediumCV. Examples include: water, sediment, air, tissue, etc.
A foreign key to the Organization that manufactured and established property values for the ReferenceMaterial
A code or short name used to identify the reference material.
The lot, or manufactured batch, of the reference material, that is often associated with a certified set of property values
The purchase date of a reference material, when applicable
The expiration date of a reference material, when applicable
A URL or file path to the Certificate that provides established property values for the given lot number.
A foreign key to SamplingFeatures. Only required when the ReferenceMaterial is Analyzed as if it were an unknown specimen.

Tbl.Cm: "Accepted" property values for a Reference Material, which can be certified by an agency or vendor, established in the literature by the research community, or developed for "in house" use only by a laboratory.

Cl.Cm: The primary key for ReferenceMaterialValues
A foreign key to ReferenceMaterials
The established property value for the ReferenceMaterial.
The established accuracy of the property value for the ReferenceMaterial, in the same units as the value.
The property that is quantified by the ReferenceMaterialValue
The units for the ReferenceMaterialValue and ReferenceMaterialAccuracy
The attribution for source that established the ReferenceMaterialValue and ReferenceMaterialAccuracy

Tbl.Cm: Extends the Results table with a foreign key to NormalizationReferenceMaterialValues when the optional DataQuality schema is implemented. In a database implementation, we would not implement this as a separate table from Results.

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier

Sch.Cm: Entities and attributes of equipment used to make observations (e.g., sensors and instruments).

Tbl.Cm: Descriptions of specific pieces of equipment.

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier
A text code that identifies the piece of equipment
A text name for the piece of equipment
CV term describing the equipment type (e.g., sensor, datalogger, solar panel, etc.)
Foreign key identifier for the model of the equipment
Manufacturer's serial number for the specific piece of equipment
Owner's inventory number for the specific piece of equipment
Foreign key identifer for the person that owns the piece of equipment
Foreign key identifier for the vendor organization for the piece of equipment
Date that the piece of equipment was purchased
A text string identifying the purchase order used to purchase the piece of equipment
A file name, path, or URL to a photo of the specific piece of equipment
Text notes about the specific piece of equipment
Unique identifier for the piece of equipment that is the parent of the current piece of equipment
Unique identifier
Unique identifier

Tbl.Cm: Describes models of sensors, loggers, and related equipment used in making observations.

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier
Foreign key identifier of the model manufacturer
A part number for the equipment model
Text name of the equipment model
Text description of the equipment model
File name, path, or URL to a specifications file for the equipment
A URL to a website having a description of the equipment model
A boolean indication of whether the equipment is a sensor/instrument used to make observations

Tbl.Cm: Information about the Variables that an instrument is capable of measuring

Sch.Cm: A general extensibility mechanism for any entity/object/table in ODM2.

Cl.Cm: Foreign key of the Action
Foreign key of the extension property added to the Action
Value of the extension property added to the Action

Tbl.Cm: Describes extension properties added to objects in an ODM database

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier
Text name of the extension property
Text description of the extension property
CV term specifying the data type of the property value
Foreign key identifier for the units of the property value

Tbl.Cm: Links extnsion properties to a Method

Cl.Cm: Foreign key identifier for the Method
Foreign key identifier for the extension property
Text or numeric value of the extension property

Tbl.Cm: Links extension properties to a Result

Cl.Cm: Foreign key identifier for the result to which the extension property applies
Foreign key identifier for the extension propery
Text or numeric value of the extension property
Foreign key of the SamplingFeature being extended
Foreign key of the extension property being added to the sampling feature
Value of the property being added to the sampling feature
Foreign key of the variable being extended
Foreign key of the extension property being applied to the variable
Text or numeric value of the extension property for the variable
Foreign Key to ExternalIdentifierSystems
A resolvable, globally unique ID, such as a DOI; could be a Uniform Resource Name (URN).
Uniform Resource Identifier (URI), preferably in the form of a persistent URL that is self-documenting and maintained by the external identifier system.

Tbl.Cm: A single table for connecting various primary keys with points to outside systems.

Cl.Cm: Primary key identifier
Defines the identifier system used (i.e. IGSN, SWRC Sample Number, etc.)
Foreign Key identifer for the organization overseeing or affiliated with the identifier system
Description of identifier system.
Universal Resource Locator (URL) for resolution/translation of an identifier system's URNs (i.e. http://dx.doi.org/ is the resolver URL for doi:10.1002/2013GL057450)
Foreign Key to SamplingFeatures
Foreign Key to ExternalIdentifierSystems
A resolvable, globally unique ID, such as a NEMI method number; could be a Uniform Resource Name (URN).
Uniform Resource Identifier (URI), preferably in the form of a persistent URL that is self-documenting and maintained by the external identifier system.

Tbl.Cm: Cross reference "linking" table to allow many to many

Cl.Cm: Foreign Key to People table
Foreign Key to ExternalIdentifierSystems
A resolvable, globally unique ID, such as an IGSN; could be a Uniform Resource Name (URN).
Uniform Resource Identifier (URI), preferably in the form of a persistent URL that is self-documenting.
Foreign Key to SamplingFeatures
Foreign Key to ExternalIdentifierSystems
A resolvable, globally unique ID, such as an IGSN; could be a Uniform Resource Name (URN).
Uniform Resource Identifier (URI), preferably in the form of a persistent URL that is self-documenting.
Foreign Key to TaxonomicClassifiers
Foreign Key to ExternalIdentifierSystems
A resolvable, globally unique ID, such as a GBIF ID; could be a Uniform Resource Name (URN).
Uniform Resource Identifier (URI), preferably in the form of a persistent URL that is self-documenting and maintained by the external identifier system.
Foreign Key to Variables
Foreign Key to ExternalIdentifierSystems
A resolvable, globally unique ID; could be a Uniform Resource Name (URN).
Uniform Resource Identifier (URI), preferably in the form of a persistent URL that is self-documenting and maintained by the external identifier system.

Sch.Cm: Information about samples and laboratory analyses for ex-situ data.

Tbl.Cm: Describes the directive or purpose under which actions are made. Directives can be projects, intended analyses for a specimen, etc.

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier.
Directive type, such as project, intended analyte/analysis for a Specimen, etc.
Text description of the directive or purpose under which the action was taken.

Tbl.Cm: Extends the FeatureActions table with a foreign key when the optional LabAnalyses schema is implemented. In a database implementation, we would not implement this as a separate table from FeatureActions, but rather just add the additional field(s).

Cl.Cm: Foriegn key identifer for the Specimen Preparation or Analysis Batch
The position or line number of a specimen within a PreparationBatchAction or an InstrumentAnalysisAction.
The label text for a specimen within a PreparationBatchAction or an InstrumentAnalysisAction.

Sch.Cm: Entities and attributes for creating and storing provenance information and versions of observations in ODM2.

Cl.Cm: Foreign key identifer of the Citation
Foreign key identifier of the Person that is an author of the Citation
Integer order of the author of the Citation starting with 1 for first author

Tbl.Cm: The Citations table is a placeholder for a near-future revision to implement Citations (or Attributions) in a manner similar to IEDA's draft "data_source" and "author_list" tables in "PetDBSchema-Redesign-26.png"

Cl.Cm: Primay key identifier
Text title of the citation
Text publisher of the citation
4 digit publication year of the citation
Full URL link to the citation
Foreign key identifier for the DataSet
Foreign key identifier for the Citation
CV term describing the relationship between the DataSet and the Citation (e.g., "cites" or "isCitedBy")

Tbl.Cm: DerivationEquations include calibration equations, normalizations, etc. on one or more RelatedResults to produce a DerivedResult.

Cl.Cm: DerivationEquations include calibration equations, normalizations, etc. on one or more RelatedResults to produce a DerivedResult.
Where y is the DerivedResult and x1, x2... are the RelatedResults specified in order by RelatedResultSequenceID

Tbl.Cm: Defines the input results that were used to create a derived result

Cl.Cm: Foreign key identifier for the provenance record describing the derived result
Foreign key indentifier for the input result from which the derived result was created

Tbl.Cm: Information about relationships among Citations

Cl.Cm: Foreign key identifier of a Citation
Foreign key identifier of a Citation related to the Citation specified by CitationID

Tbl.Cm: Information about relationships among DataSets

Cl.Cm: Foreign key identifier for a DataSet
Foreign key identifier for a DataSet that is related to the Dataset specified by DataSetID
Text relationship type chosen from a controlled vocabulary (e.g., "isNewVersionOf")
A text code indicating a version number/code if the DataSet is an explicit version of another DataSet (must correspond with a RelationshipType of "isNewVersionOf")

Tbl.Cm: Describes Results that are related to one another

Cl.Cm: Foreign key identifier of a Result
Foreign key idntifier for a Result that is related to the Result given in ResultID
Text description of the relationship shared by two results
A text code indicating a version number/code if the Result is an explicit version of another Result (must correspond with a RelationshipType of "isNewVersionOf")
An integer number indicating the order in which the related result appears in a derivation equation (vaules are only specified when RelationshipType = "isDerivedFrom")

Tbl.Cm: An optional subclass of Results where ProcessingLevel (formerly QualityControlLevel) indicates that the Result is derived from other Results. If the optional DerivationEquations table were implemented, then DerivationEquationID could be directly added to the Results table.

Cl.Cm: Primary key, and foreign key to the Results table.
Foreign key idenifier for the DerivationEquation used to calculate the Result indicated by ResultID

Tbl.Cm: Describes the provenance of a derived result

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier
Foreign key identifier of the derived result for wich the provenance is being tracked
Date/time at which the provenance record was created
UTCOffset of ProcessedDateTime
Foreign key identifier for the method used to generate the derived result
Foreign key identifier for the person that created the derived dataset

Sch.Cm: The resulting values of observations in ODM2.

Tbl.Cm: OffsetOrigins allows for for multiple coordinate systems (local reference frames), including within a microscope slide!

Cl.Cm: Primary key
Description of the origin of the coordinate system for the X, Y, and Z coordinates that specify the offset from the sampilng feature.
Units of X, Y, and Z coordinates

Tbl.Cm: Describes individual data values within a Result

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier
Foreign key identifier of the Result containing the data value
Numeric data value of the result
Date/time associated with the Result value
UTC offset of the date/time associated with the Result value
Foreign key of the offset origin
X coordinate of the value offset with respect to the offset origin
Y coordinate of the value offset with respect to the offset origin
Z coordinate of the value offset with respect to the offset origin
CV term specifying whether the result is censored or not (e.g., below a detection limit)
CV term specifying the quality of the result value
Description of the time support of the result value
CV term describing the type of aggregation or interpolation that does done over the AggregationDuration

Sch.Cm: Information about sampling features, including sites and specimens.

Tbl.Cm: Describes parrent/child relationships among Sampling Features

Cl.Cm: Foregn key identifier of a Sampling Feature
Foreign key identifier of a Sampling Feature that is the parent of the current Sampling Feature
A text description of the type of relationship among the Sampling Features
Foreign key identifier of a spatial offset from the feature parent

Tbl.Cm: Describes sampling features that are point sites

Cl.Cm: Foreign key identifier of the Sampling Feature that is the Site
A CV term describing the site type
Latitude of the site
Longitude of the site
Foreign key identifier for the Spatial Reference System that describes the latitude and longitude coordinates

Tbl.Cm: An explicit spatial relationship between a sampling feature relative to it's parent.

Cl.Cm: Primary Key of SpatialOffset
Type of SpatialOffset, such as Depth, DepthInterval, HorizaontalRadial
Numerical value for 1st SpatialOffset, which is defined by SpatialOffsetType
Units for 1st SpatialOffset, which is defined by SpatialOffsetType
Numerical value for 2nd SpatialOffset, which is defined by SpatialOffsetType
Units for 2nd SpatialOffset, which is defined by SpatialOffsetType
Numerical value for 3rd SpatialOffset, which is defined by SpatialOffsetType
Units for 3rd SpatialOffset, which is defined by SpatialOffsetType

Tbl.Cm: Describes spatial reference systems used to reference the coordinates for sites

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier
SRS code for the spatial reference system
Text name of the spatial reference system
Text notes describing the spatial reference system

Tbl.Cm: Equivalent to O&M Sampling Feature Type "Specimen". Describes physical samples or specimens.

Cl.Cm: Foreign key identifier for the Sampling Feature that is the specimen
A CV term defining the type of specimen (e.g., aquatic sample, core, etc.)
A CV term defining the medium of the specimen (i.e. water, sediment, etc.)
A boolean indicating whether the specimen was collected in the field

Tbl.Cm: This cross-reference table allows Taxonomic Classification of Specimens as an annotation, rather than as a Result.

Cl.Cm: Foreign key to SamplingFeatures.Specimens.
Foreign key to TaxonomicClassifiers.
Foreign key to the attribution, or Citation, for the classification.

Sch.Cm: Information about sensor deployment and management for in situ data.

Tbl.Cm: Destibes datalogger files created by a deployment action

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier for the datalogger file
Foreign key identifier for the deployment action that created the datalogger file
File path to the datalogger file
Text description of the datalogger file

Tbl.Cm: Describes actions that are deployment events

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier for the deployment
Foreign key identifer for the Action that is the deployment
CV term that describes the type of the deployment
A text description of the deployment
Foreign key identifier for the configuration action associated with the deployment
Foreign key identifier for the calibration action associated with the deployment
Foreign key idenfier for the SpatialOffset of the deployment
File path of of a file containing a schematic of the deployment.

Tbl.Cm: Describes photographs that were collected as part of an action (e.g., a site visit)

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier for the photograph
Foreign key identifier for the Action with which the photo is associated
File name, path, or URL of the photo file
Text description of the photograph

Tbl.Cm: Describes site visit event activities

Cl.Cm: Unique identifier
Foreign key identifier for the Action that is the Site Visit
Text description of the environmental conditions at the site when it was visited

Notes.Note: We could have a single cross-reference table. But, we would lose referential integrity with the tables that reference it as there would be no way for all of the table to share a single foreign key column.
A person does not need to be associated with an Organization, but, an Affiliation record must be created for each person because that is how people get linked to actions.

An ObservationAct is the only ActionType that can produce a ResultSet.
ActionTypeCV draft at http://goo.gl/bRi2p1
A "Result" describes metadata for one or more DataValues that are stored in ResultValues tables. Results is provides a catalog for ResultValues.
Secondary contact info can be added as an Extension property to Affiliations. See ODM2Extensions schema.
In the barebones implementation: Actions are all ObservationActs on a SamplingFeature by at least one Person using a Method producing at least one ResultsSet.
Reasons for separating ObservationActs from ResultsSets: 1. Allows Results for many Variables from each ObservationAct 2. Allows for other ActionTypes
DataValues are not included in the Core to allow for Catalog implementations.

The Citations table is a placeholder for a near-future revision to implement Citations (or Attributions) in a manner similar to IEDA's draft "data_source" and "author_list" tables in "PetDBSchema-Redesign-26.png"
In OGC O&M, Actions & Results are functionally concatenated into "Observations".

The following is the list of CVs in ODM2: ActionTypeCV AnnotationTypeCV CalibrationStandardTypeCV CensorCodeCV DataQualityTypeCV DatasetTypeCV DeploymentTypeCV DirectiveTypeCV EquipmentTypeCV InterpolationTypeCV MethodTypeCV OrganizationTypeCV PropertyDataTypeCV QualityCodeCV ReferenceMaterialMediumCV RelationshipTypeCV ResultTypeCV SampledMediumCV SamplingFeatureGeoTypeCV SamplingFeatureTypeCV SiteTypeCV SpatialOffsetTypeCV SpatialReferences SpeciationCV SpecimenMediumCV SpecimenTypeCV StatusCV TaxonomicClassifierTypeCV Units UnitsTypeCV VariableNameCV VariableTypeCV VerticalDatumCV
Look at SensorML Make sure this fits!

Equipment are often specified by ObservationActions to make measurements (i.e Results).
An EquipmentMaintenanceAction is an ActionType that does not act on SamplingFeatures or produce Results. Methods distinguish Equipment Configuration, Repair, Cleaning and other EquipmentMaintenanceActions.
An Instrument Calibration Action could either be: - an ObservationAction (if it produces a Result from a ReferenceMaterial Specimen), or - an EquipmentMaintenanceAction (if it does not).
ExtensionProperties are implemented in a way similar to ExternalIdentifiers.

An ObservationAction with MethodType=ResultDerivation can specify which RelatedResults the new Result was "DerivedFrom" [=RelationshipType].
The exact DerivationEquation can be specified in the table of that name, if the RelatedResultSequenceNumber is specified.
RelationshipTypeCV: * isDerivedFrom * isNewVersionOf See full list used by DataCite.org at http://dlib.org/dlib/january11/starr/01starr.html
A coverage can also have value types of CategoryObs, CountObs, TruthObs, etc
Values table may represent a Coverage or a "constant value" (which may be complex type)
It's useful to conceptualize Results as a catalog of values. The XYZT bounding box is available from Actions and SamplingFeatures. O&M ResultTime meaning: "the time when the result became available".

See OGC O&M documentation for definitions and specifications regarding each of these ResultsTypes. - Measurements - CategoryObservations - CountObservations - TruthObservations - TemporalObservations - GeometryObservations - PointCoverages - TimeSeriesCoverages - ProfileCoverages etc
OffsetOrigins allows for multiple coordinate systems (local reference frames), including within a microscope slide!

For now, the "ResultsValues" entitiy/table is a place is a simplification that might be able to accomodate all the different ResultTypes defined by OGC O&M. For example: - CountObservations: DataValue can be a float if Results.Variable = "Count of..." - TruthObservation: DataValue constrained to 0.0 (False) or 1.0 (True) - CategoricalObservation: accomodated by Results.TaxonomicIdentifierID and Results.VariableID = Classifier and DataValue = 0.0 or 1.0 (False or True)
This issue is being discussed within: https://github.com/UCHIC/ODM2/issues/7

How can we accomodate a Complex Result (Array Object) as shown in O&M? Arrays are allowed in PostGreSQL, but not consistently in all RDBMSs.
Can an array (such as a spectrum) be accomodated by a coverage?
FeatureParents table enables parent-child relationships between any SamplingFeatures, including between Specimens and allowing composites (i.e. multiple parents).

OGC O&M considers Points, Curves, Surfaces and Volumes all as SpatialSamplingFeatures, in which "the value of a property varies within the scope of the feature." Therefore these SamplingFeatures can be used to record Coverage results.
Sites are a special, widely used SamplingFeature type with a Point (XY) Geometry. But named, polygon (XY) spatial units (watersheds, admin units) should also be accounted for.

See OGC O&M documentation on examples of different types of SamplingPoints, SamplingCurves & SamplingSurfaces and their required attributes/metadata. Page 25 in: Cox_10-004r3_Topic_20_Observations_and_Measurements.pdf Sampling Model: https://www.seegrid.csiro.au/wiki/AppSchemas/ObservationsAndSampling#Sampling_model
SpatialOffsetTypeCV: - Draft at http://goo.gl/uOgK8U
SamplingFeatureTypeCV: - Draft at http://goo.gl/DBvZko

Can SensorDeployment be an ObservationAct, in which the Results table gets new rows (one for each variable) but for which there are not yet any data values? Or if ResultType = TimeSeries (or ActionType = Deploy and Observe), then additional field are added (similar to Specimens being a subclass of SamplingFeatures).
